SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Bluetooth
Bluetooth class that extends the WirelessIO class.
BME280
BME280 class that extends the TempSensor class.
Configuration
Configuration class to read the configuration file and initialize the system.
Device
Abstract class representing a general device.
DHT11
DHT11 class that extends the TempSensor class.
Display
Abstract class representing a display device.
Displays
The Displays class is a utility class that creates display objects (LCD, OLED) based on the given type, protocol, and device ID.
GY951
GY951 class that extends the IMUSensor class.
HWSystem
Represents the hardware system that manages ports and connected devices.
I2C
Represents an I2C communication protocol.
IMUSensor
Abstract class representing an IMU sensor.
LCD
LCD class that extends the Display class.
Main
The Main class serves as the entry point of the system.
MotorDriver
Abstract class representing a motordriver device.
MotorDrivers
The MotorDrivers class is a utility class that creates motordriver objects (PCA9685, SparkFunMD) based on the given type, protocol, and device ID.
MPU6050
MPU6050 class that extends the IMUSensor class.
OLED
OLED class that extends the Display class.
OneWire
Represents a OneWire communication protocol.
PCA9685
PCA9685 class that extends the MotorDriver class.
Port
Represents a port in the system that can be occupied by a device and uses a specific protocol.
Protocol
Represents a communication protocol interface.
Sensor
Abstract class representing a sensor device.
Sensors
The Sensors class is a utility class that creates sensor objects (DHT11, BME280, MPU6050, GY951) based on the given type, protocol, and device ID.
SparkFunMD
SparkFunMD class that extends the MotorDriver class.
SPI
Represents a SPI communication protocol.
State
Represents the power state of a device, indicating whether it is turned ON or OFF.
TempSensor
Abstract class representing a Temperature sensor.
UART
Represents a UART communication protocol.
Wifi
Wifi class that extends the WirelessIO class.
Wireless
The Wireless class is a utility class that creates wireless objects (Bluetooth, Wifi) based on the given type, protocol, and device ID.
WirelessIO
Abstract class representing a wirelessio device.
